LineGeometry Class

Definition

Represents the geometry of a line.

In this Article

public sealed class LineGeometry : System.Windows.Media.Geometry

Remarks

To create multiple connected lines, use a LineSegment or Polyline segment with the PathFigure and PathGeometry classes.

Freezable Features: Because it inherits from the Freezable class, the LineGeometry class provides several special features: LineGeometry objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe. For more information about the different features provided by Freezable objects, see Freezable Objects Overview.

Constructors

LineGeometry()

Initializes a new instance of the LineGeometry class that has no length.

public LineGeometry ();

LineGeometry(Point, Point)

Initializes a new instance of the LineGeometry class that has the specified start and end points.

The start point of the line.

endPoint
Point

The end point of the line.

Initializes a new instance of the LineGeometry class.

public LineGeometry (System.Windows.Point startPoint, System.Windows.Point endPoint, System.Windows.Media.Transform transform);

Point

The start point.

endPoint

The end point.

transform
Transform

The transformation to apply to the line.

Properties

Bounds

Gets the axis-aligned bounding box of this LineGeometry.

public override System.Windows.Rect Bounds { get; }
Value
Rect

The axis-aligned bounding box of this LineGeometry.

Remarks

This property does not take into account the area potentially added by a Pen.

EndPoint

Gets or sets the end point of a line.

public System.Windows.Point EndPoint { get; set; }
Value
Point

The end point of the line. The default is (0,0).

public System.Windows.Point StartPoint { get; set; }

Methods

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this LineGeometry, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry Clone ();
Returns
LineGeometry

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this LineGeometry object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

public System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
LineGeometry

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

Returns

To be added.

GetArea(Double, ToleranceType)

Gets the area of the filled region of this LineGeometry object.

public override double GetArea (double tolerance, System.Windows.Media.ToleranceType type);
Parameters
tolerance
Double

The computational tolerance of error.

type
ToleranceType

The specified type for interpreting the error tolerance.

Returns
Double

The area of the filled region of this LineGeometry object, which is always 0 because a line contains no area.

IsEmpty()

Determines whether this LineGeometry object is empty.

Returns
Boolean

true if this LineGeometry is empty; otherwise, false.

Determines whether this LineGeometry object can have curved segments.

Returns
Boolean

true if this LineGeometry object can have curved segments; otherwise, false.
